info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Windy Conditions Expected in the Eastern Magic Valley...Southern Hills...and Raft River Region Late Friday Night and Saturday Morning... An approaching winter storm will swing a cold front through central and eastern Idaho starting Friday afternoon, and peaking late Friday night and Saturday morning. Look for increasing southerly wind Friday afternoon. By late Friday night, southwest to west wind will increase to the 20 to 30 mph range with gusts to around 45 mph. Wind will stay in this range through Saturday mid- day at least, then slowly decrease during the afternoon and evening. Temperatures will cool from Friday afternoon highs in the 55 to 75 degree range to Saturday afternoon highs in the 30s to around 50, a decrease of 20 to 25 degrees Fahrenheit over the 24 hour period. Snow accumulations even in the mountains should remain light.
